VIII.iv.2.D.3.d
.
Assigning Noncompensable Evaluations in FPOW Claims
Consider the possibility that the disability at issue was more severely disabling in the past, even if residuals currently exist but not to a degree warranting the assignment of a compensable evaluation.
If this is the case, the establishment of SC with a noncompensable evaluation may be in order.
Note
:  The law and regulations do not require a
current
finding of disability warranting the assignment of a compensable evaluation at the time the claim for SC is filed.  Historical evidence of a compensable evaluation is acceptable to grant SC on a presumptive basis even if the disability is currently noncompensable.
title: M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart iv, Chapter 2, Section D - Rating Claims Based on Former Prisoner of War (FPOW) Status
